instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message:
Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
Magsafe is blinking. 
25 seg - OFF
6 seg - ON

<SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> - 3.3V always
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_FUSE</SIGNAL> - 16.6V Always

Diode mode:
DCIN – 1 and 1
PPVBUS-G3H – 1 and 464 

Any idea why magsafe is blinking? Already tried 2 dc boards. <SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN_FUSE</SIGNAL> too low?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message: Blinking on-off or green-orange? Check current sensing and chrgr boot on the ISL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message:
Blinking on - off. Green - off.
I have 12.6V stable in PPVBUS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message: ACOK high when light is off? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high? Disconnect keyboard to rule that out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message:
ACOK - 3.25V always
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3V always, but I noted that each 30-35seg is goes to 0V for 0.5seg.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message: No. Comes from other workshop with gpu replaced.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> magsafe blinking
threads.message: Oh, fucked up garbage. Isn't there a short on some of the GPU power rails?
